title.en: sSNO: A simple Standard Name Ontology

author: Matthias Probst (https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8729-0482), Institut für Thermische Strömungsmaschinen

creator.value: Matthias Probst (https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8729-0482), Institut für Thermische Strömungsmaschinen

abstract.value: This is an ontology draft for the usage of standard names as a simple way of describing complex data. It is motivated by the [cf-conventions](http://cfconventions.org/), which introduced the concept of standard names originally. However, SSNO may (at this stage) not cover all aspects of the original, therefore it is called "simple". With this ontology, its usage shall be applicable to other research topics, too. The core idea is to provide the class StandardName and StandardNameTable with a minimal set of properties. The rules of standard name construction is defined in a document associated with the standard name table. The table contains all standard names defied by a project or community. Instances of StandardName and StandardNameTable can be used e.g. in combinations with other ontologies like [metadata4ing](https://nfdi4ing.pages.rwth-aachen.de/metadata4ing/metadata4ing/) for a concise description of a numerical variable.

title.value: sSNO: A simple Standard Name Ontology

definition.value: A 'Variable' is a symbolic object that stands for a numerical defined 'Mathematical' object like e.g. a number, a vector, a matrix.
Unit of measure.
Representing any physical unit.
Special Qualification accounting for Vector Standard Names. Only one such Qualification must exist at max in a StandardNameTable

comment.en: A vector component qualification holding values like "x", "y" and "z" can modify vector standard names like "velocity" but not scalar standard names like "pressure".

definition.value: A qualification derives an existing standard name by a rule. This may alter the units.
Person or Organization related to a StandardNameTable.
A standard name table holds a list of all available standard names used in a certain context (project, domain, ...) and gives further information about version and contact.
A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.
A variable that expects a float or integer as a value
A role is the function of an entity or agent with respect to an activity, in the context of a usage, generation, invalidation, association, start, and end.

comment.en: An enterprise (potentially individual but typically collaborative), planned to achieve a particular aim

definition.value: A transfromation is a phrase which may be added to the standard name without changing its unit.
A standard name is defined by a canonical unit and a description. It generally is defined by a standard name table.
An HDF5 Dataset.

A concept which defines the construction of a standard name, e.g. by adding specific phrases following well-defined rules. It extends or changes a base standard name and hence may or may not change the unit of it.

Attribution is the ascribing of an entity to an agent. When an entity e is attributed to agent ag, entity e was generated by some unspecified activity that in turn was associated to agent ag. Thus, this relation is useful when the activity is not known, or irrelevant.
A standard name associated with scalar data.
Quantity value, i.e., a value that has a numerical magnitude and a physical unit
An HDF5 file root group
A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations.
A standard name associated with vector data.
Points to a Concept, that describes a numerical variable, which uses the standard name.
Associates a character to a thing, which is intended to be a AnyStandardName or a Qualification.
A character i.e. a single letter or symbol
An alphanumeric identifier for a project.
Points to a Qualification or Transformation defined by a Standard Name Table
Name for a standard name, e.g. "x_velocity". The construction of a standard name string is defined by the standard name table. E.g. no spaces are allowed and specific pre- and suffixes are allowed.
Relates a thing, e.g. a netCDF4 file, an HDF5 file or another resource to a standard name table which is associated to the standard names used in the file.
The version of the Standard Name Table. Best is to adhere to semantic versioning described here: https://semver.org/

Attribution is the ascribing of an entity to an agent. When an entity e is attributed to agent ag, entity e was generated by some unspecified activity that in turn was associated to agent ag. Thus, this relation is useful when the activity is not known, or irrelevant
The character whcih is used in a standard name transformation string to indivate the position a standard name used in the modification rule.

example.value: in the transformation string "integral_of_Y_wrt_X" the standard name representation characters are be "X" and "Y"

definition.value: Used to provide metadata about the data the property is provided with. E.g. uncertainties can be expressed/linked like this. As stated in the cf-conventions, the "nature of the relationship between variables associated via ancillary_variables must be determined by other attributes" https://cfconventions.org/Data/cf-conventions/cf-conventions-1.7/build/ch03s04.html)

Refers to another qualification to indicate the order. The qualification it points to is ordered after this one. It can also point to a standard name, which means that this qualification is used right before it.

A human-readable label of a variable which is should be used in addition with a standard_name. As intended in the cf-conventions (https://cfconventions.org/Data/cf-conventions/cf-conventions-1.7/build/ch03s02.html), it may be used for labeling plots.

Points to a ssno:StandardName associated with the Concept. The Concept should is expected to be describing a numerical quantity because a ssno:StandardName defines and describe a numerical quantity by providing a description and expected canonical unit.
The name of the item.

The prov:agent property references an prov:Agent which influenced a resource. This property applies to an prov:AgentInfluence, which is given by a subproperty of prov:qualifiedInfluence from the influenced prov:Entity, prov:Activity or prov:Agent.
Points to one or more scalar or vector standard names defined in a standard name table.
The unit of the standard name. The unit of an individual standard name must be convertable to this unit.
A Research Organization Registry identifier, that points to a research organization
Points to a concept, which uses a standard name table.

Refers to another qualification to indicate the order. The qualification it points to is ordered before this one. It can also point to a standard name, which means that this qualification is used right after it.

comment.undefined: Recommended practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to an identification system. Examples include International Standard Book Number (ISBN), Digital Object Identifier (DOI), and Uniform Resource Name (URN). Persistent identifiers should be provided as HTTP URIs.

definition.value: Relates two qualifiactions or a qualificaiton and a standard name to each other.
A string defining how the new unit is generated.

example.value: "[X] s-1" where [X] is the unit of the standard name X.

definition.value: Associates a Qualification or Transformation to a Standard Name Table
Points to one or more scalar or vector standard names defined in a standard name table.
Relates a thing, e.g. a netCDF4 file, an HDF5 file or another resource to a standard name table which is associated to the standard names used in the file.
Relates a thing, e.g. a netCDF4 file, an HDF5 file or another resource to a standard name table which is associated to the standard names used in the file.
Points to the ssno:StandardNameTable defining the ssno:StandardName.
Associates a Qualification or Transformation to a Standard Name Table
A keyword or tag describing the resource.
prov:wasRoleIn references the association (e.g. between an agent and an activity) in which a role shall be defined. Inverse property of prov:hadRole.
A relationship defining a set of values used by the qualification.
Points to a concept, which uses a standard name table.
Points to a concept, which uses a standard name table.
Links a transformation to a character used in the transformation string to represent a standard name or qualification
Description of a Standard Name, a qualification or a transformation.
A data property that stores prepositional qualifiers like "at," "in," "due to," and "assuming." to be used with Qualifications.

example.value: The CF Convention uses the qualification 'in process' where 'in' is the preposition and 'process' the qualificaiton.

definition.value: A personal mailbox, ie. an Internet mailbox associated with exactly one owner.
Associates a Qualification or Transformation to a Standard Name Table
Points to the ssno:StandardNameTable defining the ssno:StandardName.
